verses.verse: O give thanks<WH3034> unto the LORD<WH3068>, for he is good<WH2896>: for his mercy<WH2617> endureth for ever<WH5769>.
Let the redeemed<WH1350> of the LORD<WH3068> say<WH559> so, whom he hath redeemed<WH1350> from the hand<WH3027> of the enemy<WH6862>;
And gathered<WH6908> them out of the lands<WH776>, from the east<WH4217>, and from the west<WH4628>, from the north<WH6828>, and from the south<WH3220>.
They wandered<WH8582> in the wilderness<WH4057> in a solitary<WH3452> way<WH1870>; they found<WH4672> no city<WH5892> to dwell<WH4186> in.
Hungry<WH7457> and thirsty<WH6771>, their soul<WH5315> fainted<WH5848> in them.
Then they cried<WH6817> unto the LORD<WH3068> in their trouble<WH6862>, and he delivered<WH5337> them out of their distresses<WH4691>.
And he led them forth<WH1869> by the right<WH3477> way<WH1870>, that they might go<WH3212> to a city<WH5892> of habitation<WH4186>.
Oh that men would praise<WH3034> the LORD<WH3068> for his goodness<WH2617>, and for his wonderful works<WH6381> to the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>!
For he satisfieth<WH7646> the longing<WH8264> soul<WH5315>, and filleth<WH4390> the hungry<WH7457> soul<WH5315> with goodness<WH2896>.
Such as sit<WH3427> in darkness<WH2822> and in the shadow of death<WH6757>, being bound<WH615> in affliction<WH6040> and iron<WH1270>;
Because they rebelled<WH4784> against the words<WH561> of God<WH410>, and contemned<WH5006> the counsel<WH6098> of the most High<WH5945>:
Therefore he brought down<WH3665> their heart<WH3820> with labour<WH5999>; they fell down<WH3782>, and there was none to help<WH5826>.
Then they cried<WH2199> unto the LORD<WH3068> in their trouble<WH6862>, and he saved<WH3467> them out of their distresses<WH4691>.
He brought them out<WH3318> of darkness<WH2822> and the shadow of death<WH6757>, and brake<WH5423> their bands<WH4147> in sunder<WH5423>.
Oh that men would praise<WH3034> the LORD<WH3068> for his goodness<WH2617>, and for his wonderful works<WH6381> to the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>!
For he hath broken<WH7665> the gates<WH1817> of brass<WH5178>, and cut<WH1438> the bars<WH1280> of iron<WH1270> in sunder<WH1438>.
Fools<WH191> because<WH1870> of their transgression<WH6588>, and because of their iniquities<WH5771>, are afflicted<WH6031>.
Their soul<WH5315> abhorreth<WH8581> all manner of meat<WH400>; and they draw near<WH5060> unto the gates<WH8179> of death<WH4194>.
Then they cry<WH2199> unto the LORD<WH3068> in their trouble<WH6862>, and he saveth<WH3467> them out of their distresses<WH4691>.
He sent<WH7971> his word<WH1697>, and healed<WH7495> them, and delivered<WH4422> them from their destructions<WH7825>.
Oh that men would praise<WH3034> the LORD<WH3068> for his goodness<WH2617>, and for his wonderful works<WH6381> to the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>!
And let them sacrifice<WH2076> the sacrifices<WH2077> of thanksgiving<WH8426>, and declare<WH5608> his works<WH4639> with rejoicing<WH7440>.
They that go down<WH3381> to the sea<WH3220> in ships<WH591>, that do<WH6213> business<WH4399> in great<WH7227> waters<WH4325>;
These see<WH7200> the works<WH4639> of the LORD<WH3068>, and his wonders<WH6381> in the deep<WH4688>.
For he commandeth<WH559>, and raiseth<WH5975> the stormy<WH5591> wind<WH7307>, which lifteth up<WH7311> the waves<WH1530> thereof.
They mount up<WH5927> to the heaven<WH8064>, they go down<WH3381> again to the depths<WH8415>: their soul<WH5315> is melted<WH4127> because of trouble<WH7451>.
They reel to and fro<WH2287>, and stagger<WH5128> like a drunken man<WH7910>, and are at their wits'<WH2451> end<WH1104>.
Then they cry<WH6817> unto the LORD<WH3068> in their trouble<WH6862>, and he bringeth them out<WH3318> of their distresses<WH4691>.
He maketh<WH6965> the storm<WH5591> a calm<WH1827>, so that the waves<WH1530> thereof are still<WH2814>.
Then are they glad<WH8055> because they be quiet<WH8367>; so he bringeth<WH5148> them unto their desired<WH2656> haven<WH4231>.
Oh that men would praise<WH3034> the LORD<WH3068> for his goodness<WH2617>, and for his wonderful works<WH6381> to the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>!
Let them exalt<WH7311> him also in the congregation<WH6951> of the people<WH5971>, and praise<WH1984> him in the assembly<WH4186> of the elders<WH2205>.
He turneth<WH7760> rivers<WH5104> into a wilderness<WH4057>, and the watersprings<WH4325><WH4161> into dry ground<WH6774>;
A fruitful<WH6529> land<WH776> into barrenness<WH4420>, for the wickedness<WH7451> of them that dwell<WH3427> therein.
He turneth<WH7760> the wilderness<WH4057> into a standing<WH98> water<WH4325>, and dry<WH6723> ground<WH776> into watersprings<WH4325><WH4161>.
And there he maketh the hungry<WH7457> to dwell<WH3427>, that they may prepare<WH3559> a city<WH5892> for habitation<WH4186>;
And sow<WH2232> the fields<WH7704>, and plant<WH5193> vineyards<WH3754>, which may yield<WH6213> fruits<WH6529> of increase<WH8393>.
He blesseth<WH1288> them also, so that they are multiplied<WH7235> greatly<WH3966>; and suffereth<WH4591> not their cattle<WH929> to decrease<WH4591>.
Again, they are minished<WH4591> and brought low<WH7817> through oppression<WH6115>, affliction<WH7451>, and sorrow<WH3015>.
He poureth<WH8210> contempt<WH937> upon princes<WH5081>, and causeth them to wander<WH8582> in the wilderness<WH8414>, where there is no way<WH1870>.
Yet setteth he the poor<WH34> on high<WH7682> from affliction<WH6040>, and maketh<WH7760> him families<WH4940> like a flock<WH6629>.
The righteous<WH3477> shall see<WH7200> it, and rejoice<WH8055>: and all iniquity<WH5766> shall stop<WH7092> her mouth<WH6310>.
Whoso is wise<WH2450>, and will observe<WH8104> these things, even they shall understand<WH995> the lovingkindness<WH2617> of the LORD<WH3068>.
